alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 7:48AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Rio Grande at Embudo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar but below the Taos Junction Bridge may be affected due to flooding. Water is about to flow over the center section of the low swinging bridge upstream of the Embudo Gauging Station. This wooden bridge is used by local residents who live on the west side of the river. No significant damages are expected until the river rises to 12 feet or higher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1015 PM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe
